newsitem.title: HONDURAS: Bomb explodes in Honduran courthouse, one killed.
newsitem.headline: Bomb explodes in Honduran courthouse, one killed.

text.p: A bomb exploded in Honduras' main courthouse on Thursday, killing at least one person and injuring several, local radio reported.
A police spokesman confirmed to Reuters that a bomb had exploded, and said several people were injured.
"A high-powered bomb exploded in the offices of the courts in Tegucigalpa, causing several injuries," the spokesman said.
The local HRN radio station reported "several people injured and at least one dead."
On October 4, a bomb went off in the offices of the Honduran Congress, shattering windows but causing no injuries.
The same day, police deactivated a bomb placed in the ruling Liberal Party headquarters.
